Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Solely \Sole"ly\, adv. Singly; alone; only; without another; as, to rest a cause solely one argument; to rely solelyn one's own strength. [1913 Webster]

solely adv : without any others being included or involved; "was entirely to blame"; "a school devoted entirely to the needs of problem children"; "he works for Mr. Smith exclusively"; "did it solely for money"; "the burden of proof rests on the prosecution alone"; "a privilege granted only to him" [syn: {entirely}, {exclusively}, {alone}, {only}]
